page.title: 11Stoke House
page.content: Stoke House is an attractive country house owned by Mr. Vinton, an American. It dates back from the later part of the Georgian Era. It is a red brick building with a slate roof. 36 acres of parkland surround the house. There is a stable block, an ornamental lake, 4 acres of gardens, a swimming pool, a tennis court, a lodge and a gardeners cottage. The trees in the park suffered from Dutch Elm Disease and were replaced by Oak, Ash, and Poplars. Mr and Mrs Vinton have started to breed horses. They are hunters and at present they have eight horses. They employ 1 groom and a girl from the Youth Training Scheme to look after them. Mr. Frohawk is the head gardener and he has a part time helper. A lady works daily in the house.
